name: MSpec
help: MSpec is called a 'context/specification' test framework because of the 'grammar' that is used in describing and coding the tests or 'specs'.

properties.name: Assemblies
properties.help: Assemblies with tests to be executed.

properties.name: Filters
properties.help: Filter file specifying contexts to execute (full type name, one per line). Takes precedence over tags.

properties.name: Includes
properties.help: Executes all specifications in contexts with these comma delimited tags. Ex. <c>-i 'foo, bar, foo_bar'</c>.

properties.name: Excludes
properties.help: Exclude specifications in contexts with these comma delimited tags. Ex. <c>-x 'foo, bar, foo_bar'</c>.

properties.name: HtmlOutput
properties.help: Outputs the HTML report to path, one-per-assembly w/ index.html (if directory, otherwise all are in one file). Ex. <c>--html=output/reports/</c>

properties.name: XmlOutput
properties.help: Outputs the XML report to the file referenced by the path. Ex. <c>--xml=output/reports/MSpecResults.xml</c>

properties.name: TeamCity
properties.help: Reporting for TeamCity CI integration (also auto-detected).

properties.name: AppVeyor
properties.help: Reporting for AppVeyor CI integration (also auto-detected).

properties.name: TimeInfo
properties.help: Shows time-related information in HTML output.

properties.name: Silent
properties.help: Suppress progress output (print fatal errors, failures and summary).
